title: 旧约 - 约伯记(Job) - 第 35 章
subTitle: 旧约 -- 约伯记(Job) -- 第 35 章 ( 本篇共有 42 章 )

lineList.en: Thinkest thou this to be right, that thou saidst, My righteousness is more than God's?
lineList.cn: 你以为有理，或以为你的公义胜于神的公义，

lineList.en: For thou saidst, What advantage will it be unto thee? and, What profit shall I have, if I be cleansed from my sin?
lineList.cn: 才说这与我有什么益处。我不犯罪比犯罪有什么好处呢。

lineList.en: I will answer thee, and thy companions with thee.
lineList.cn: 我要回答你，和在你这里的朋友。

lineList.en: Look unto the heavens, and see; and behold the clouds which are higher than thou.
lineList.cn: 你要向天观看，瞻望那高于你的穹苍。

lineList.en: If thou sinnest, what doest thou against him? or if thy transgressions be multiplied, what doest thou unto him?
lineList.cn: 你若犯罪，能使神受何害呢。你的过犯加增，能使神受何损呢。

lineList.en: If thou be righteous, what givest thou him? or what receiveth he of thine hand?
lineList.cn: 你若是公义，还能加增他什么呢。他从你手里还接受什么呢。

lineList.en: Thy wickedness may hurt a man as thou art; and thy righteousness may profit the son of man.
lineList.cn: 你的过恶，或能害你这类的人。你的公义，或能叫世人得益处。

lineList.en: By reason of the multitude of oppressions they make the oppressed to cry: they cry out by reason of the arm of the mighty.
lineList.cn: 人因多受欺压就哀求，因受能者的辖制（辖制原文作膀臂）便求救。

lineList.en: But none saith, Where is God my maker, who giveth songs in the night;
lineList.cn: 却无人说，造我的神在那里。他使人夜间歌唱。

lineList.en: Who teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth, and maketh us wiser than the fowls of heaven?
lineList.cn: 教训我们胜于地上的走兽，使我们有聪明胜于空中的飞鸟。

lineList.en: There they cry, but none giveth answer, because of the pride of evil men.
lineList.cn: 他们在那里，因恶人的骄傲呼求，却无人答应。

lineList.en: Surely God will not hear vanity, neither will the Almighty regard it.
lineList.cn: 虚妄的呼求，神必不垂听。全能者也必不眷顾。

lineList.en: Although thou sayest thou shalt not see him, yet judgment is before him; therefore trust thou in him.
lineList.cn: 何况你说，你不得见他。你的案件在他面前，你等候他吧。

lineList.en: But now, because it is not so, he hath visited in his anger; yet he knoweth it not in great extremity:
lineList.cn: 但如今因他未曾发怒降罚，也不甚理会狂傲，

lineList.en: Therefore doth Job open his mouth in vain; he multiplieth words without knowledge.
lineList.cn: 所以约伯开口说虚妄的话，多发无知识的言语。
